intro: Cyrtandra waikamoiensis, commonly known as the Waikamoi ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the wet season. Cyrtandra waikamoiensis is endemic to a specific area on Maui and is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Its conservation status highlights the importance of preserving native Hawaiian flora.
